Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different types of habitats, making sure to include one land habitat and one water habitat.
The student can illustrate various living things found in the land habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, and animals like lizards and squirrels.
The student can depict different living things present in the water habitat, such as fish and aquatic plants.
The student can display differences in biodiversity by showing a variety of living things in each habitat.
The student can highlight observations that reveal patterns of plant and animal diversity across the two habitats.
